title: Attention Spans & Focus
summary: The real poison that nobody talks about

body.raw:
I didn't realize how cooked I really was until I was bored this summer and tried to read a nonfiction book.

I read from time to time, but since I'd been busy with school, I haven't got the chance to read in a while.

After reading a few pages, my mind kept drifting away and my focus was astonishingly low.

I kept thinking about totally irrelevant things, and this happened every ~40 seconds. Even in the night with no devices, it was hard for me to read.

In this sense, it was apparent that my brain valued thinking more than it did acquiring new information right in front of me.

It hasn't always been like this - I used to be able to focus and read at one point, but it seems that recently I've lost that ability.
